info.title: SATP Gateway Client (Business Logic Orchestrator)
info.description:
SATP is a protocol operating between two gateways that conducts the transfer of a digital asset from one gateway to another. The protocol establishes a secure channel between the endpoints and implements a 2-phase commit to ensure the properties of transfer atomicity, consistency, isolation and durability.

This API defines the gateway client facing API (business logic orchestrator, or BLO), which is named API-Type 1 in the SATP-Core specification.

**Additional Resources**:
- [Proposed SATP Charter](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/charter-ietf-satp/)
- [SATP Core draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-satp-core)
- [SATP Crash Recovery draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-belchior-satp-gateway-recovery/)
- [SATP Architecture draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-satp-architecture/)
- [SATP Use-Cases draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ramakrishna-sat-use-cases/)
- [SATP Data sharing draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ramakrishna-satp-data-sharing)
- [SATP View Addresses draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ramakrishna-satp-views-addresses)

externalDocs.description: For more information about the SATP Gateway Client, refer to the official documentation.

tags.name: transaction
tags.description: API endpoints for interacting with blockchains via gateways

tags.description: API endpoints for fetching information on SATP sessions

post.description: Attempts to cancel a previously submitted transaction intent using its session ID.

status.description: Current status of the SATP session.

substatus.description: More detailed status of the SATP session.

stage.description: Current stage of the SATP session.

step.description: Current step within the stage of the SATP session.

startTime.description: The start time of the SATP session.

cancelSuccessful.description: Indicates whether the cancel operation was successful.

default.description: An error occurred or transaction cannot be cancelled

get.description: Get a list of possible routes for swapping one asset for another across multiple exchanges
get.summary: Get a list of routes for a gateway-to-gateway asset transfer

schema.description: The network of the DLT being interacted with. TODO: implement network identification draft

parameters.name: fromAmount

schema.description: The amount in string format including all decimals.

parameters.description: The amount that should be sent including all decimals.

parameters.name: fromToken
parameters.description: The token that should be transferred. Can be the address or the symbol.

schema.description: The network of the DLT being interacted with. TODO: implement network identification draft

parameters.name: toToken
parameters.description: The token that should be transferred to. Can be the address or the symbol.

parameters.name: toAddress
parameters.description: The receiving wallet address. If none is provided, the fromAddress will be used.

schema.description: A collection of available and unavailable routes

id.description: A unique identifier of the route.

gatewayID.description: A unique identifier for the gateway.

fromDLTNetworkID.description: The ID of the DLT Network where the transfer will originate.

fromAmountUSD.description: The amount of 'fromToken' to be transferred in USD, specified as a string to maintain precision.

fromAmount.description: The amount that should be sent including all decimals (e.g., 1000000 for 1 USDC (6 decimals)).

chainID.description: The network of the DLT being interacted with. TODO: implement network identification draft

decimals.description: How many decimals the token supports.

logoURI.description: The logo of a token, chain, dex etc.

tags.description: List of tags identifiers providing additional context or categorization.

priceUSD.description: The current price of the token in USD.

additionalProperties.description: Information about the bridge used for the token transfer.

tokenAddress.description: The address of the token being transferred.

verified.description: Indicates whether the token is verified.

toDLTNetworkID.description: The ID of the DLT Network where the transfer will end.

toAmountUSD.description: The expected amount to be received in USD.

toAmount.description: The expected amount to be received including all decimals (e.g., 1000000 for 1 USDC (6 decimals)).

toAmountMin.description: The minimum expected amount to be received including all decimals (e.g., 1000000 for 1 USDC (6 decimals)).

get.description: Audits transactions based on provided filters such as start and end dates. Optionally includes proofs generated from each gateway transaction.

parameters.name: auditStartDate
parameters.description: The start date for the audit period.

parameters.name: auditEndDate
parameters.description: The end date for the audit period.

parameters.name: includeProofs
parameters.description: Include proofs generated from each gateway transaction.

proofs.description: An array of strings representing proofs.

auditStartTime.description: The start datetime of the audit period.

auditEndTime.description: The end datetime of the audit period.

x-enum-descriptions: Identities with the group:admin scope are administrators of the system.
Identities with the group:user scope are end users of the system who only have authorization to perform a limited set of actions.

AuthzJwtClaim.description: Stores global constants related to the authorization of the application. Specifically enumerates the claims to validate for as per RFC 7519, section 4.1. See: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519#section-4.1
x-enum-descriptions: The "iss" (issuer) claim identifies the principal that issued the JWT. The processing of this claim is generally application specific. The "iss" value is a case-sensitive string containing a StringOrURI value. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

auditStartDate.description: The start datetime for the audit.

auditEndDate.description: The end datetime for the audit.

includeProofs.description: Include proofs generated from each gateway transaction.

proofs.description: An array of strings representing proofs.

auditStartTime.description: The start datetime of the audit period.

auditEndTime.description: The end datetime of the audit period.

items.description: Details about a specific fee cost associated with the transaction.

amount.description: The amount in string format including all decimals.

amountUSD.description: The amount in string format including all decimals.

included.description: Indicates if the fee is included in the transaction amount.

gasCosts.description: A collection of estimated gas costs for executing the transaction.

type.description: The type of the gas cost.

price.description: The gas price, specified as a string to maintain precision.

estimate.description: The estimated gas required, specified as a string to maintain precision.

limit.description: The gas limit for the transaction, specified as a string to maintain precision.

amount.description: The amount of gas required in the gas currency.

amountUSD.description: The amount of gas required in USD.

chainID.description: The network of the DLT being interacted with. TODO: implement network identification draft

decimals.description: How many decimals the token supports.

logoURI.description: The logo of a token, chain, dex etc.

tags.description: List of tags identifiers providing additional context or categorization.

priceUSD.description: The current price of the token in USD.

additionalProperties.description: Information about the bridge used for the token transfer.

tokenAddress.description: The address of the token being transferred.

verified.description: Indicates whether the token is verified.

executionDuration.description: The estimated duration for the transaction execution in seconds.

fromAmountUSD.description: The amount in string format including all decimals.

toAmountUSD.description: The amount in string format including all decimals.

tool.description: The tool or service used to generate this estimate.

toolDetails.description: Describes integration or tool details such as bridges or exchanges involved in the transaction.

key.description: A unique identifier for the integration or tool.

name.description: The name of the integration or tool.

logoURI.description: URL to the logo of the integration or tool.

name.description: The name of the integration or tool.

includedStepIds.description: IDs of further steps included within this step, allowing for nested actions without direct recursion.

state.description: The state of insurance applicability for the transaction.

feeAmountUsd.description: The fee amount for insurance, represented in USD.
